Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Shawny75
Reviews.Content: This was a reasonable hotel to stay at for an overnight stay in Toronto. Shuttle a bit off putting, you had to phone hotel. Some people were quite rude, not understanding that there are several Best Westerns. Room fine. Michele's restaurant excellent if a bit pricey. Good bruschetta.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay after long transcontinental flight”
Reviews.Author: MandyLee_7
Reviews.Content: We parked our vehicle here for the duration of our holiday and spent the night upon our return last December. We were pleased with the prompt response by the hotels airport shuttle service after the grueling 21 hour return flight from Thailand! The on-site breakfast was appreciated the following morning and we had a good nights rest in the comfy bed. The only aspect I would mention is the very crowded parking lot at this hotel, we spent a good half hour combing through the densely packed lot before finding a vacant spot to park. We will use this hotel to park, fly and sleep again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcoOttawa
Reviews.Content: We recently went to and from Los Angeles with an overnight stay in Toronto. We booked the Best Western Plus Hotel, Toronto Airport directly on-line with excellent results. This was the hotel on Eglington West - note that there is another Best Western nearby on Dixie Rd. They provide free airport shuttle (10 mins) between 4 am and midnight. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. There is a business centre available for e-mails and printing boarding passes, as well as an exercise room with whirlpool, and laundry room. The establishment is very clean throughout. They also offer free breakfast in the morning. There is a private restaurant attached to the hotel where we had a very pleasant meal. It is called Michele and offers an Italian menu at reasonable prices. The room was excellent. Very roomy with all amenities and an excellent bed; it is very quiet even so near the airport runways. The room included a microwave oven and a large bar fridge. Of note, you need to book the morning shuttle to the airport on arrival as they are very busy in the morning. We left off on the first shuttle and it was full with other people waiting. On our return north our flight was cancelled and we had to skip our stop at the hotel. We will return next trip as it is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for airport”
Reviews.Author: sunglassesOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a second time overnight between flights, in February, and were glad that we did. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful as usual, the room modern with every convenience imaginable, and lots of extra towels. Very comfortable bed, reasonably good breakfast included in price, which included bacon and scrambled eggs, yogurt and some whole fruit, waffles etc.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE SERVICE AND NICE ROOM AND BED”
Reviews.Author: OLivia H
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, staffs are very kindly and helpful, as to the hotel which is very clean and the room is nice and the bed is so comfortable. It also offers a very nice breakfast. I will go and stay in this hotel again ^.^ By OLivia Hon

Reviews.Title: “Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: AnnGr
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for one night in January. This hotel was excellent for the price we paid. A complimentary shuttle to and from the airport - although you have to make sure you call the hotel directly to arrange pick up from the airport as they don't send a regular shuttle like some of the other hotels do. Room was very clean and with new updated furnishings. Great bathroom. Would definitely recommend this hotel to someone that needs access to Pearson Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Full marks in its category”
Reviews.Author: JPC1628
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights there, two weeks apart, on both ends of a trip South. We only booked this hotel when the Sandman was full. I guess that's what you get for writing a positive review :) Caution: there is another Best Western, which also calls itself Best Western Plus Airport, on Dixie Rd. This review is about the one on Eglinton Avenue. But this hotel won us over and we now have a choice of two hotels with restaurant, which is very useful in this thruway desert zone around Pearson airport, but if you get there after 10 p.m., it's pizza only, delivery only. Nothing else for miles. The room was smaller than most (your roommate will have to make you move if you are working at the desk and (s)he wants to get to the other chair or the window), furnished in the requisite dark wood and silver accents. There is a work-size desk (the free wifi worked beautifully), two excellent beds, a bigger than average fridge with good-size freezer compartment (we take frozen food on our trips to the islands, with mixed result at security: some agents will let it go if it is frozen solid) and good size flat=screen TV. On the other hand, drawer space is dismal (three small one next to the fridge), and the clothes closet is adequate, not one inch more. Bathroom is fine, and it was spotless. Sleep quality in the rooms at the 'back' (overlooking the parking lot and golf course) is excellent. The shuttle service, on time and exact, is outstanding (6mn., 10 in rush hour traffic). The staff also deserve great praise, from the desk clerks to the shuttle drivers: friendly, efficient and helpful, they know that at airports promptness is paramount. The attached restaurant (MIckele's, note the k, probably to ensure the Italian pronunciation) is very good (see separate review), and serves as the locale for the complimentary so-so breakfast (no hot items in the buffet). Our bill for one night, dinner for two with wine was under $190 all included (taxes and tip), which has to be excellent value. And they cheerfully kept a bag of our winter stuff, no charge, for the two weeks (and retrieved it immediately on request). All in all, an excellent experience, and an address to keep in mind when traveling through Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly Package Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mickeychickcanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January 12, 2012 before flying to Cozumel for a week. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable. Bathrooms were a bit plain, but still functional. The shuttle to the airport at 4:30 in the morning was great - the driver was wonderful. Very social and courteous. A great place to stay and before flying out of Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel for Parking and Flying”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family before leaving on vacation in December 2011. The location is easy to get to, South of the 401, and about 5 minutes from the airport. There is not much within walking distance for restaurants, but there is an Italian restaurant onsite, which doubles as the free breakfast area in the morning. The room was clean and quiet, with comfortable beds and 12ft ceilings (ground floor). The breakfast is pretty much a standard continental breakfast: (toast, cereal, fruit, oatmeal, waffles and tea/coffee/juice.) All the staff are very friendly, and we had excellent and efficient shuttle van service to and from the airport. It was very nice having the shuttle van arrive for pickup upon our return in less than 10 minutes. (Unlike many other airport hotels I've experienced, waiting 20 minutes or more.) I would recommend this hotel all around, but especially if you are looking for one close to the airport with reasonable park and fly rates and free airport shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Visitor”
Reviews.Author: ian h
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this hotel and have always found the staff very helpful and friendly. The rooms have recently been upgraded and the decor (which was always of a high standard) is now exceptional.'The hotel is spotlessly clean and is a credit to the housekeeping staff, I would not hestitate to recommend this hotel and it provides an excellent shuttle service to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandla
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to sleep for 2 nights over Christmas, while visiting familiiy. The location was convenient, close to the highways. Everything was clean; the room was well equipped with mini-fridge (that didn't make noise all night like some), microwave, and toiletries; quiet, even though it's close to the airport (we were on the south side, backing on golf course and hydro right-of-way). The breakfast, set up in the attached restaurant, was as good as expected. The rate (CAA/AAA) was excellent. We'll stay here again next Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: Great value, clean, everything was in order and very pleasantly decorated, breakfast included, staff were very helpful, no complaints whatsoever. The location is good for the airport but that's about it, There really isn't much walking distance,however as a airport hotel, this one is reccomended and there is a good italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: Sitko
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for overnight between planes. Room was clean, reasonably appointed and bed was comfortable. Next door is a good Italian restaurant which was handy so I did not have to look for a place to eat. Continental breakfast was included and was satisfactory, nothing special but did the trick when you just want to eat and get back to the airport quickly. Staff friendly, check-in and out prompt. Close to the airport with good shuttle service. I will stay here again when I have to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Dawn300
Reviews.Content: Went in December 2011, all good, nothing to complain about. I would just advise that it is more like a business hotel than a warming welcome. Don't get me wrong, staff is polite!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: burooxtwo
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently did a Sleep, Park and Fly at this hotel. It was clean, staff was pleasant and the shutle service was good. We found it convenient to the 401 and a great deal for out-of-towners who would like to be near the airport the day of their flight. We stayed the night, got a shuttle to and from the airport and left our car on-site for the week. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and good value”
Reviews.Author: gailhen
Reviews.Content: This Best Western hotel is one of the nicest we have stayed at. Included with the room was the shuttle to and from the airport, breakfast for 2 and friendly staff. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmc291
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in this hotel and were very impressed. We chose the location as it was near to the airport and only a thirty minute drive into Toronto ( unless it was rush hour!). The hotel was far less expensive than a downtown hotel would have been. The rooms were large and immaculate, breakfast was buffet style but quite substantial and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for less!”
Reviews.Author: ellejay74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while attending medical appointments in Toronto. We usually stay downtown to be close to the appointments, but it gets expensive when downtown hotels are generally $150+ per night plus 30 or 40 for parking. So since the appointments allowed time for driving, we decided to stay further away from downtown. I am usually the one to book our hotel rooms and stick with brands like Westin, Sheraton, Hilton, etc. One of the most important things to me in a hotel is a comfortable bed, and those hotels generally deliver. But when I read that Best Western Plus has similarly comfortable beds I thought we'd give it a try. We had booked a regular room with king bed, but when we arrived we found out we'd been upgraded. When we got to our room it looked like the honeymoon suite! Large room with a heart-shaped jacuzzi tub (too bad we didn't have time to use it). And the bed was divine, I slept like a baby. The only reason it gets 4 out of 5 is the continental breakfast in the morning (which is another reason we booked this hotel) wasn't the greatest. Nothing healthy on the menu at all.... all the cereals are high in sugar, muffins, fruit, make-your-own waffles (which was tricky), bread for toast (which my husband found mold on). The only protein offered was a hard-boiled egg (yuck). But other than that it was a good hotel, and close to Square One if you want to do some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: Quinners_11
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on proximity to Toronto Transit. I had been staying in uptown Toronto and wanted to be closer to the airport for an early flight. What a fabulous night, quiet, very nicely appointed room and meal at the adjacent restaurant was superb. I just wish I'd known to bring a bathing suit...a whirlpool would have capped this exceptional stay! I will be back to be sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I like this place, very clean and nice rooms, quite at night even though it's near the airport. The free parking and WiFi was a good bonus. The restaurant attached to the hotel is independent but the food for dinner on both nights was excellent, and they even do room service with a wireless debit/credit card machine. The bed - great! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're flying in or out of Pearson.....stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kalamalkared
Reviews.Content: This place is great! They seem to have thought of every detail. Clean, quiet, comfortable. Friendly helpful staff. Free internet stations for us old fossils. Handy airport shuttle.....phone as soon as you land and they'll be there to pick you up. Breakfast was fine. Also it was very handy to have an onsite restaurant (a beautiful one, at that) for dinner, as---like the other airport hotels---you are in the middle of a warehouse wasteland here. Our room faced a busy road but we didn't notice the noise as we had the AC/heating unit fan on. Highly recommended. A welcome gem after all the overpriced dingy hotels we had just seen in Italy. Make sure you get this Best Western, on Eglinton.....there are lots of other Best Westerns in Toronto area also.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Z747
Reviews.Content: As a person who doesnâ€™t like hotels very much, I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. My first observation was how quiet the neighborhood was despite being close to the airport. It really helped to have free parking and the rates were very reasonable. The room was a little small, but very clean. The service was incredible. When we asked about good restaurants in the area, the staff was so kind as to print directions for us. The free continental breakfast was wonderful. I was glad I didnâ€™t get a hotel inside the city and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Les N
Reviews.Content: I travel around Canada, mainly in the province of Ontario, I stay many nights in this hotel. This is by far the hotel where I feel totally comfortable, the staff are all helpful and friendly, the hotel is quite, beds comfortable what else can I hope for when I am away from home. I feel like this is my home away from home. Rooms have recently been renovated, a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: justprincess
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as an alternative of the very expensive downtown Toronto hotels (during the TIFF festival) on our route to Niagara Falls. And we were very pleased with our choice: the rooms are clean with very comfortable beds; the staff is very nice and well prepared (they gave us very exact and written indications about all the touristic sites we asked about); the hotel is only 15 minutes drive to downtown; and even if very close to the airport, we did not hear any loud and disturbing sounds! The breakfast is basic, but they announce it as an European, not American plan. For sure we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Can`t Remember A Hotel I Enjoyed More”
Reviews.Author: SofiaFofana
Reviews.Content: I absolutely enjoyed every moment of my stay at the Best Western Plus in Toronto. The room was well decorated, good size, very comfortable king sized bed and great shower. My husband loved the big flatscreen tv, the mini fridge, microwave and we both enjoyed the continental breakfast in the classy restaurant. I would definitely recommend it and will go back myself for sure and will look for Best Western Plus wherever I go now.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Yeahhhh--Coming Back"”
Reviews.Author: fitR99
Reviews.Content: Well well well...thanks to the amazing staff at this Bestwestern...I'll definitely be back. My pal and I stayed there as we were competing in the Toronto Fitness Model Competition on March 19, 2011 and they were in close proximity to the International Center without charging an arm and a leg. After visiting the site, speaking with General Manager Akbar..I decided to book, I was glad I did. Folks from the time I arrived at the airport...the shuttle was on time and I felt great about my selection. The 2nd day of my stay dealt with Front Desk Manager Tusaif Azmat!!! Oh My God....This representative is just amazing, Super informative and always just willing to extend himself to make sure whatever assistance you need...its taken care of. [KUDOS to you TUSAIF!!!!!!!] His warm personality surely helps to pick up the evening. Now the next amazing person is Tuyen. If there's any financial hitch or mistake--Tuyen to the rescue and with much clarity. Apparently I'd overpaid a few dollars on my stay and believe me..Tuyen realized and quickly took care of the issue before I left....and I was very appreciative of it. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends and will definitely go back. For Breakfast.. you get tickets upon checking to be utilized at the restaurant adjoining the hotel for the duration of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: 6voyageurs
Reviews.Content: Perfect for an overnight stay. Kind and helpfull people at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not really by the airport...”
Reviews.Author: SunnyCalGirl
Reviews.Content: To people from Toronto, this hotel would probably be considered "by the airport"...it is not on the airport strip like the Radisson, for example. It's actually south of the airport and would not be that easy to find for the average traveler unless he/she had a GPS unit or very good instructions. The hotel does have shuttle bus, however and the folks who work there are actually very accommodating. We asked for a non-smoking room and that's exactly what we got. The whole second floor is non-smoking and we did not even sense a whiff of smoke anywhere on the property. That was nice! Our room was very comfortable...clean, recently renovated with flat screen TV and in-room coffee, microwave and fridge. It was also very, very quiet. We had a sound night's rest which was very much appreciated after a lonnnnng day traveling from California. That was nice too! The complimentary breakfast at the adjoining restaurant was standard BW fare but the coffee was fresh and pretty good. There were several different cereals--hot and cold. There were muffins, croissants and other breads for toast along with hard boiled eggs and some fruit. We also saw a waffle iron but didn't have any. All-in-all, a good breakfast to get you going in the morning. The night before we had the restaurant make us a pizza because we'd missed supper. Although they were about to close (it was quite late...almost 11 p.m. on a Sunday), one of the waiters graciously offered to have the kitchen make us whatever pizza we wanted and offered to deliver it to our room so we didn't have to wait...I think he could tell we were exhausted. Although a bit pricey for its size, it was a good snack to tie us over for the night. I would definitely stay here again. The gentlemen at the desk were very professional and helpful especially since we got lost in the torrential rain while trying to find the hotel and my nerves were a bit frazzled. A comfortable room and good service hit the spot and that's exactly what we got. That was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: lasha205
Reviews.Content: Near Vancouver airport (there's a shuttle), clean and comfortable with friendly and helpful staff. Ideal for the solo traveller in between flights. I was lucky enough to get a discount from online booking, which made it even more worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_retiree
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit. (On the previous stay, we were there for one week during the Christmas period, in Dec. 2010, when it was very quiet.) Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Also, the airport shuttle service was excellent in both directions. Just one point to note, though, is that you have to watch closely to ensure that your Best Western reward points are posted to your account within one week. For our Christmas trip, we didn't get the points posted until I contacted Best Western a few months later.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: stanita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel for three days at the beginning of June, while we were in Toronto for a celebration, as well as for visiting friends and relatives. The primary things we look for are cleanliness and properly working facilities. Cleanliness was a non-issue. The hotel had several plus features. The room iequipped with a microwave, mini-refrigerator, desk and work area, cable T.V., free wireless internet, a clock radio, a coffee maker, and free local telephone calls. The other facilities are a small fitness center ( step machine, treadmill, bicycle, and a Universal Gym - all good quality and good working order). There is a hot tub (which we did not try). There is free parking and free airport shuttle. Long term parking is availale for about $5.00 per day. A free hearty continental breakfast is offered. It featured juices, fresh fruit, tea and coffee, hard boiled eggs, a variety of breads and bagels, a large choice of breakfast pastries and muffins, as well as a "do-it-yourself" fresh waffle station. Free morning local newspapers are available. The street on which the hotel is situated, is in a business (not industrial) park. There is car traffic in the morning and late afternoon. There is no truck traffic. There is a large choice of restaurants within two blocks, as well as a convenience store. The rest of the time, quieteness rules. The hotel does NOT lie under airport approaches, so plane noise is not a concern. Our room, in the rear, faced a golf course, so the only disturbance was the very occasional 'thwack' of a golf ball. Another plus was , even though the hotel was near the airport, getting to central and northern Toronto was not a problem, as Eglinton Avenue goes all the way across the city. The slight extra travel time was a good trade-off for the reasonable room rates. Would we recommend this property ? Without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: mylifemyrules
Reviews.Content: There is no where to go on foot if you leave the hotel, luckily I was just there for a night. It was very dark inside and old fashioned deco. The gym .. well I wouldn't call it a gym.. it was just a room with a couple of machines in. Staff not particularly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkenwood
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, check in and checkout was hasel free, the room was clean and comfortable. A continental breakfast came with the room and newspapers were available at the front desk. It was one of the better Best Westerns I have stayed at and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GerryAnnieM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going on vacation with an early flight (6:30am departure) from Toronto. We live in Cambridge so we decided to stay over and take advantage of their stay,park&fly package. The room was very comfortable & clean. We went in for dinner at Michele's and had a great pizza. Our shuttle was on time and we were ready for our vacation. Upon return, our flight was delayed by 1 hour thus putting us in just before 12 midnight and their shuttle stops at that time, however they were quick in accommodating us with a pick up back to the hotel for our vehicle. Thank you Best Western, we will definitely stay there again on our future travels....Gerry&Annie M.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: StephMajor
Reviews.Content: Good service from start to finish, absolutely nothing really to complain about. Shuttle arrived promptly to quoted time, staff very friendly and helpful. If I ever come back to Toronto, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great experience overall”
Reviews.Author: farm1234567
Reviews.Content: directions to hotel were great. Staff very attentive. suggestion Drink on check in would have been good ie coffee juice. Better pillows/more pillows needed. Juice in room for non coffee drinkers. More shampoo and conditioner, we were two people sharing one small shampoo and one small conditioner, not enough, more please. More variety in dinning room. Provide food package deals for resturaunt, eg deal of the day or pick 3 items get one good price ect. TIPPING must it be nessessary to tip staff ??? Deals on park and leave car great. Stayed with hotel because hotel offered two weeks free parking on a one night stay. Keep up good work will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near Pearson”
Reviews.Author: vafrica
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, quiet, good service, business centre where you can print your boarding passes for free. Free transport to and from the airport. What's not to like! Other amenities are located within just a few minutes walk including a great Thai restaurant that's reasonably priced. Will definitely stay here again for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't think of a better place to stay , for the price when flying out of Toronto Airport.”
Reviews.Author: travellover795943
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times now and find the shuttle to the airport very fast and reliable. They also have an excellent park and fly program that lets you park for longer than some other hotels do. The restaurant has a very good menu and the included breakfast is very good also. If you need to leave for the airport before breakfast is served they have snacks available free of charge that you can take on checkout. We have not been disappointed in the service yet and the staff is always very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “convenient , good value”
Reviews.Author: hartsoupAlberta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we had an overnight on the way to the Grand Cayman from Calgary. We chose this property as they had an airport shuttle to and from the airport and breakfast was included. We used Best Western points so it didn't cost us a penny . Bonus. Very comfy beds, nice and clean, friendly staff. The attached Italian restaurant had great caesar salad and pizza and was beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location close to major highway”
Reviews.Author: wybren
Reviews.Content: If you can not sleep because of truck traffic noise this is the place to stay. With a golf course right behind it it can not be more quiet. Enjoy the free breakfast in the restaurant attached to it.

Reviews.Title: “Two Best Western 2 different Hotals!!”
Reviews.Author: artist96
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the US at the Best western in watertown... WOW what a great hotel .. service cleaniliness, food accomidations respect ... Highly recommended. Then we come here. TV does not work well, all poor visibility, really needs a new TV!! the AC makes noise and you cannot sleep, not tomention that you cannot even open the window so you do not need the AC to waste energy!! No toiletries, good thing we brought our own.. Came for breakfast, the waffles are not even freah you can warm them!! The OJ was not real but from concentrate and the coffee was weak. You cannot bring anything fromt he restaurant to your room. It closed at 10 am and they locked the patrons inat 10 am!! You had the option of buying a breakfast from the restaurant... thats how you can get real food!! Now lets go back to the Hotel in Watertown!! Breafast until 9:30 and it was amazing fresh fruit, fresh fruit salad. Eggs Bacon toast bagels a variety of freah juices that are not warm by the way(like the TO hotel.!! I think that the owrst part is being given vouchers for breakfast, really makes you feel lioke a child!! Lets get it together!! Two countries, same chain 2 totally different ways of doing business, I honestly -being a Canadian- am embarssed for having this type of Service- You can say that it is for travellers but it should be the same quality from the Same chain or you would think that would be the case... no not recommended unless all you want to do is sleep for 125.00 a night!! Because in the US for Canadian funds at the same amount you get Much much MUCH More bang for your buck!! also you only have 5 min to use the business centre and there is no one here, so we are being asked to please respect others time.. there is no one here.. If the interenet in the room worked that would mean I can use my own lap top.!! and not be here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, breakfast not so good.”
Reviews.Author: valeryg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before the flight and one night on return, and left the car at the hotel for one week while we were away on vacation. The latter was the main reason why we booked this hotel rather than the other Best Western near the YYZ airport, even though that one offered much cheaper rate. Some people on TripAdvisor complained about the convenience and security of long-term parking there, so we opted for the BW Travel Inn â€“ indeed no problems with parking. The hotel is good for those flying in/out of Toronto, though the location is probably not very convenient for much else â€“ it is a mixture of industrial area on one side and a golf course on the other. The building is a newer one and everything in and out of the room is very clean. Did not have time to use the jacuzzi, though it looked great. The room on the return leg had stuffy smell when we checked in because the air conditioner/ventilation was left off. The air cleared quickly when we switched the system on. It was a little tight to catch the shuttle minivan after our 11 pm arrival flight, since they operate the shuttle only until midnight. Fortunately, we did not have to wait long for the luggage and called the hotel immediately â€“ they sent the minivan in 15 minutes. The breakfast was really poor, not on par with other Best Westerns and similar chains I have stayed in. We â€œenjoyedâ€� it only on the second morning, since they start breakfast at 6:30 (I would say it is rather late for an airport hotel) and we had to leave the hotel with the 6:15 shuttle for our departure flight. They gave granola bars and bottled water at the reception in lieu of coffee/breakfast for people leaving early.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: vacation_spec_007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious, the staff courteous and went out of their way to assist us. We were not far from the airport yet either the hotel is off the flight path or they were not using an approach that would take airplanes over the hotel, as it was quiet. The breakfast buffet is typical of this category of accomodation and the waiter did try to upsell us to a full breakfast for $5. Overall, it was a good value and would not hesitate to recomend the hotel for either business or for family related travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cngw
Reviews.Content: The first thing that strikes you about this hotel is the friendliness and professionalism of the staff - they really made me feel extremely welcomed! Mr. Kabir and Tusaif are marvellous hosts! On arriving, I called the hotel for the shuttle and they were expecting me, told me exactly where to meet the shuttle and, in 15 minutes, Tusaif collected me for the pleasant 10-minute drive to the hotel. Checking-in was extremely easy and everything with the reservation was in order. The lobby is immaculate and tastefully furnished - everything appears to be quite new. The furnishings in the room are also new and everything exceptionally clean. Everything worked, there were adequate toiletries and coffee and the room is equipped with a microwave and mini-fridge (which gets to freezing!) The WiFi worked well and was complimentary. The location of the hotel is good, if your business is in the area. It is very near to the Centennial Park Plaza with a couple of restaurants, a convenience store and a Tim Horton's. Two bus routes run near the hotel - one goes to Islington station. From there the subway / TTC / Rocket goes downtown. The other bus line goes from Spectrum Way (about 3 minutes walk from the hotel) takes about 15 minutes to get to the Square One Shopping Centre. A rented vehicle will save loads of time in getting around though! For the rate (less that $100) and, once the location is suitable, this is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable room, friendly helpful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sunglassesOttawa
Reviews.Content: Our room on the ground floor, was well furnished and beautifully appointed, with lots of toiletries, and a very comfortable bed, with good pillow top mattress. The heating/ fan was very quiet. Breakfast was good with lots of fresh fruit, though I would have liked some yogurt, and high fibre cereal. A relaxing stay, with excellent easy to use shuttle service to airport. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable, Easy and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: tipintnet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best I have experienced for park and fly in Toronto and area. The staff was so helpful and kind including, Tusaif, Monica and Kevin. The hotel is more like a european style with big comfy rooms like you would find in a 3 or 4 star in Rome or Paris. There is a fitness room and wifi. The hotel restaurant is amazing and brand new. It is Italian and called Michele's. The truth is we had the best pizza ever in Canada here from the Italian built wood fired oven....OMG it was fantastic. The shuttle to the lobby was included and on time and we left our vehicle on the low cost package for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, shuttle service lacked a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: OceanBelle
Reviews.Content: January 8/10 we arrived in Toronto, phoned the hotel & asked for the shuttle service. We were told it would be 15 to 20 minutes. We went to the designated pickup spot and waited & waited. Finally my husband went back in and phoned again to which he was told it was going to be a little longer since the shuttle had just started a run just AFTER our first call. It was forty minutes standing in the freezing cold before a Middle Eastern woman picked us up. No apology was offered and on the ride to the hotel she turned the heat right down. We were offered no compensation by the hotel. On our return trip (January 18/10) again we phoned for the shuttle at 10:30 pm. We were told it would be forty minutes and that at the last ten minutes then go out to the designated pick up spot (which is what we did). Forty minutes came and went and finally I went into the airport to warm up and I called the hotel and asked where the shuttle was. They told me it would be five or ten minutes. When the driver FINALLY arrived after one hour of waiting, he told my husband he had been there a half hour before, which was an out and out lie as we had been standing there. So after an hour (and by this time it was past 11:30 pm) a young middle eastern man finally arrives and puts our bags into the car. He, just as the previous driver, turns DOWN the heat. We are tired and cold and told him to turn it back up. And with him we had to tell him twice to turn the fan up. We had to be up at 5 in the morning b/c they could NOT get us to the airport when we needed to be. They only have one small van and were booked for the later sessions. Four hours sleep, standing in the freezing cold, no coffee or breakfast at that time of the morning, I would DEFINITELY NEVER stay here again. Our Irish driver in the morning was thoughtful, chatty and arrived to pick us up slightly before our designated time. When we arrived at the airport we told him he was the most pleasant driver we had had from this hotel. Unfortunately, for us he only drives in the early morning hours. The hotel room was fine but the shuttle service was horrible and because of the shuttle service I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for layover out of Pearson”
Reviews.Author: travellerdave2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western for two nights at each end of our European cruise flying out of Pearson. One of the few "Airport Hotels' that allow you to leave your vehicle on premises more than 7 days without an extra charge. This moderate 3 story hotel is located on the south side of the 401, about 15 minutes from the airport terminals. They run a free airport shuttle from 5:00AM to Midnight. The shuttle operates on the hour and must be booked prior to using it. When you arrive at the airport a quick call to the hotel desk and the shuttle comes directly to pick you up. One of the benefits is that few people staying here are on a "park n' fly" program so the shuttle is not busy plus the hotel has it's own van which is a bonus as others in the area share a van/bus which are croweded and takes forever to drop off or pick up. The hotel is situated on Eglington Ave in a primarily commercial office district with few retail outlets such as restaurants and convenience stores close by. The onsite restaurant was being renovated during our stay so the hotel made arrangements with the donut shop next door to provide a complimentary breakfast free of charge with your stay. The staff are excellent, very helpfull and give the feeling that they are there to make sure your stay is trouble free. The hotel is a newer building and rooms are pretty well standard with a small fridge and microwave. The bathrooms are spacious and very bright. The airconditioner/heater is a window-floor unit and can be loud at times. This hotel also offers suites with a heart shaped Jacuzzi and huge sitting area, one of the larger hotel rooms we have stayed in. The beds are the standard Best Western with pleny of pillows and one thing we did notice is that the rooms we stayed in were pretty sound proof even being next the the elevator. The best thing is the price, much lower than most of the closer Airport hotels and with the additional parking allowed this Best Western is a winner all around. If you wish further information please do not hesitate to email me at: [--]. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wishdonn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed repeatedly at the Best Western Travel Inn at 5503 Eglington Ave. W., and have use its airport shuttle and extended car-park service. We are always extremely pleased with the friendly staff, especially Tusaif and Adele. We are always given a terrific room, often upgraded, and the rooms are clean, bright and very comfortable. Breakfast is complementary and more than adequate, with offerings of fresh fruit, juice, coffee or tea, pastries, cereal, waffles, various breads. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: ssr58
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively,all over the world,and I must say it is difficult to find a hotel that give you that down home feeling.The entire staff,was terrific,and I have already sent an e-mail out to all of my business associates and friends that travel to inform them where to stay.Please keep up the good work.... Lawyer Stanley Jr. ( Africa World trade LLC) stan5846@yahoo.com [--]

Reviews.Title: “Nice Layover Hotel for YYZ”
Reviews.Author: YWGJetsTraveller
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for a night as our flight to the Caribeen required an overnight stay in Toronto, and this looked like the best bet. No complaints. Rooms were clean and the breakfast was nice. Paul, the AM Shuttle driver was the highlight of the experience, and we would book here again just to see Paul again. He was AWESOME! Overall, decent place to stay, no complaints, breakfast was typical Continental, with the addition of Hot Waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sj_indian_travel
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and new hotel. The only issue is that it is a bit far from downtown Toronto (about 30 minutes drive which could get longer depending on Toronto's horrible traffic). The hotel is brand new. The rooms are very nice. They have complimentary breakfast (but u have to ask for it.. they dont tell u that :()

Reviews.Title: “Location was the only good point”
Reviews.Author: luckywilbury
Reviews.Content: Booked through ratestogo.com for an overnight stay when our flight was cancelled. Service and cleanliness were terrible. We booked a non-smoking room but were told on check-in that because we had booked the same day, had to take a smoking room. Front desk service extremely slow and rude. Went to our room to find that it had not been made up since last guests, still had dirty sheets in the middle of the bed etc. Went back to ask for new room/room to be made up and staff rude and unapologetic. Got a new room (still smoking one - absolutely reeked and no windows to air it out, the smell stunk out all of our travel gear) but it was still not very clean, eg. hairs still in the bathroom. Overall extremely poor service and hygiene. Also on checking out we were billed a much higher rate than the one we had secured through the website, tried to explain to the front desk but they refused to budge and we had no choice but to pay about $35-40 over.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but with issues”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye2108
Reviews.Content: Made reservation at AA.com. Good - not great - price that did include free parking. However, the lot was very poorly kept with very little lighting and difficult to see stripes. It is a dump and especially the rear part of the facility. I did not feel comfortable parking my car here. Front desk folks were superb. Very nice and accommodating. A/C units in the room were too loud. They worked well, but were far too noisy. Speaking of noisy, I could not believe how noisy it was inside - especially with the doors. They actually slammed shut and we heard many, many doors that night. This was very bothersome and needs to be addressed immediately. They don't have to slam shut! One last issue. My daughter and I tried to use one of the 2 business center computers. Just our luck, but on both nights there was some type of family reunion. No kidding...10-15 people including small kids were crammed into this room all vying for computer time. No time limits or any attempt by the desk folks to limit either time or even the number of people in this small space. Bottom line: Good price, but I would not stay there again. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but disappointed with Hotel Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Flames89
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during a layover in Toronto before flying to Calgary. The reviews were good and the cleaniness and ammenities did not dissappoint. I probably would have ranked this 5/5 considering the price but I dropped it all the way to a 3/5 because of the hotel shuttle. I called in advance to confirm that the shuttle was free and that all I had to do was call the hotel when I arrived at the airport that evening. Unfortunately our flight was delayed and we got in past midnight. When I called for the shuttle I was informed that the shuttle stops at midnight and i had to take a cab. The cab cost $27 dollars for a 5 minute ride. This was ridiculous. The main reason why i booked here was because of the shuttle. I was not informed that the shuttle service ends at a particular time and that the only other alternative was a money goughing cab ride. When we got there we discussed this with the front desk and he was utterly unsympathetic. "It's a complementary service" is all he kept saying. Fair enough, but his attitude was not helpful at all. Next morning we booked the shuttle early and made sure it was available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Short Layover Stay”
Reviews.Author: hawaiishoegirlie
Reviews.Content: When I'm traveling through Canada and end up in Toronto for an overnight stay, I always find myself at the Best Western Travel Inn Toronto! It's close to the airport, so I can sleep in and not worry about traffic, there's an hourly shuttle, the rooms are HUGE and comfortable and the price is unbeatable. I've stay here about 3 times now in the past 3 months, and have never had any complaints. If you're catching an early flight, your AM driver will be Paul, who's from Ireland and can weave a good spell during the 5 minute drive to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Handy Airport Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Doug&Sharon
Reviews.Content: July 7 2007 we just needed to overnight near Toronto airport and this worked out well. There is a free airport shuttle (hourly) complimentary breakfast (basic) restaurant (inside or outside dining). Room was very clean and contained a fridge and a microwave. We heard no airport noise. Staff were somewhat disinterested but we had no problems at all

Reviews.Title: “ideal airport stay”
Reviews.Author: harryhols
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the best western for three nights arrived after a flight from the UK tired had pre booked and just wanted somewhere not far from the airport as it was our first time to toronto. We were pleased with the room overlooked the golf course and had everything you would need for a short stay, clean roomy fridge microwave nicely decorated free car parking and breakfast hot and cold.The staff were friendly and delt with and questions. Free use of internet pc available.The area is close to the major highways for access to toronto.There are a number of restaurants and fast food outlets also an indoor ten pin bowling sprt centre within walking distance which has a bar and food cheaper beer and pizza fries, there is a petrol station near by also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Stunt_Girl
Reviews.Content: Great value! Rooms: bright, spacious, clean, great Simmons Beautyrest bed. Free coffee and tea in the room. Features a fridge with a small freezer, and a microwave. Amenities: free internet, free breakfast, pool, spa, free shuttle to the airport. Service: Excellent service, staff are willing to give directions or anything else you may need. The only thing I could possibly complain about is that the maid doesn't wait long enough after knockng before entering the room.....but that is not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “In Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: swimpuppy
Reviews.Content: Chose this because of the two reviews here, both pretty good ratings, and it's fairly close to the airport. Right next to it! Lobby was very nice and had elevator! Went to our room on 3rd floor and when entering room, we were amazed! It was fairly big and roomy. Considerably big bathroom, then a fully mirrored folding door to closet with iron and ironing board. Then it's the roomy bed, coffee table with a couch, desk & mirror with desk lamp, a standing lamp, and 2 lamps next to the bed! TV in a big wooden thingy with drawers. Called front desk for extra pillow and was told to look in drawer under TV & found it (very convenient!). The AC works great since it's so hot in the summer (although the lobby and hallways..and the room when we entered...were kinda hot, after turning on the AC, we're all set. Oh! And free high-speed wireless internet access! Just bring in laptop with wireless thingy! Just arrived a few hours ago and loved this place so much just wanted to share this NOW! Would definately come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: apebro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a stopover hotel. Used my airmiles for the hotel, but think the $89 a night is a fairly good rate. Front desk had our keys waiting for us upon arrival. Used the shuttle service to and from the airport, efficient and safe. Shuttle runs at quarter past the hour, which didn't meet our schedule. They changed the schedule for us so we wouldn't have to take a cab, much appreciated. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable. Ate at the newly re-opened restaurant Mawal, and it was fantastic. The owner Ramos is a very nice man who has had health issues and is now back running his restaurant. We ordered the smoked salmon and the order was so big, we couldn't finish it. Great value for $11. The greek salad was very good also. We will stay here again if the need arises.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Travel Inn in January, 2006 as my stopover hotel in Toronto. I booked this hotel because it offered a free airport shuttle and a complimentary breakfast for a good price for the area. I found all that was promised and received good value. Once I called the hotel from the airport, the shuttle came within 20 minutes. Check in was smooth and I was pleased with the room and amenities. There is a good sized mini fridge, a microwave oven and a large TV with free movies. My problem with my stay was encountered when I requested information for catching a bus to the subway station. I was told when I booked this hotel that I could get a bus conveniently and easily to the subway. I know a bit about the Toronto transit system and felt comfortable with this, but feel that not only was the information that I was provided false, it was not substantial enough to be of assistance to somebody who didnâ€™t have my level of experience in this city. When I was ready to leave, I stopped by the front desk to ask where I catch the bus and was told to walk â€œ4 blocksâ€� down the street to the bus stop. The distance to the bus stop may have been equivalent to 4 blocksâ€™ distance, but it wasnâ€™t a measured 4 blocks which is very confusing. The bigger problem is that once I got to the bus stop I found it marked as running during peak periods only and this was at 2 p.m. I referred to some information that I had and aimed toward a totally different street for the bus, passing another hotel en route. When there I thought I would confirm my information with them and was told that you couldnâ€™t get a bus at that time of the day and that guests at their hotel who were looking to get to the subway took a cab there. I could have saved an abundance of time and inconvenience if the Travel Inn had told me this information from the beginning. The next problem was that I had asked the desk clerk at the Travel Inn how much the bus cost and was advised that it is $2.25 so I pulled out that amount of cash to have it ready. It was a small thing, but I was angered to find that the price is actually $2.50. I might expect these 2 pieces of misinformation from a stranger on the street who is not in the business of guest services or dealing with people who are from out of the city or province. I think that there is no excuse for these mistakes from somebody advising a foreigner and in a position where one would be led to believe that advice! The continental breakfast offered a variety of items and my transfer back to the airport was efficient. I would recommend this hotel as a stopover hotel at the airport, but caution travelers that the cab to the subway will cost $20 and that the information gleaned from the front desk staff, though pleasantly delivered may be erroneous.

Reviews.Title: “Great room !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great room at a great price. Relatively new hotel. High speen internet access. Will stay again on my next trip to Toronto next week. Highly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Travel Hotel Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5503 Eglinton Avenue West, Toronto, Ontario M9C 5K5, Canada
